title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) and
Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) and
heading: 4. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
4. Regulation 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 
of the following definition for the definition of “Covid-19 Passenger Locator 
Form”: 

“ ‘Covid-19 Passenger Locator Form’ means the form set out in the Schedule or 
a form to like effect, made available electronically by the Health Service 
Executive, that may only be completed electronically;”.
text_norm: 4 regulation 2 principal regulation amended substitution following definition definition covid-19 passenger locator form covid-19 passenger locator form mean form set schedule form like effect made available electronically health service executive may completed electronically

the State it organises, effects or facilitates, shall - 

A travel organiser, in relation to a person whose arrival in

(a)

take reasonable steps to inform the person, where 
he or she is an international passenger, of his or

where the person has not, to the satisfaction of the 
travel organiser, demonstrated that he or she has a 
PLF receipt relating to himself or herself. 

(2) 
Paragraph (1)(c) shall not apply in relation to a person whose 
arrival in the State is organised, effected or facilitated by a travel 
organiser where the person declares to the travel organiser, or an officer, 
employee or agent of the travel organiser, that he or she is not an 
international passenger. 

(3) 

In this Regulation, “travel organiser” means a person who - 

(a) 

(b) 

by providing a person with access to or use of a 
vehicle, organises, effects or facilitates the arrival 
of the person in the State, and 

is - 

(i) 

(ii) 

a body corporate, or 

in relation to a person who organises, 
effects or facilitates the arrival of the 
person in the State by providing access to 
or use of a vehicle on a private and 
exclusive basis, 
the owner of such 
vehicle.”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) and
heading: 7. Regulation 6 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
7. Regulation 6 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 

of the following paragraph for paragraph (1): 

“(1) Where a relevant person or a member of the Garda Síochána 
considers it necessary to do so, he or she may request an international 
passenger to provide such information or documentation as may be 
required in order to verify any particular stated on a Covid-19 Passenger 
Locator Form completed by that international passenger or on a PLF 
receipt provided by that international passenger.”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) and
heading: 9. The Principal Regulations are amended by the insertion of the following
text_raw:
9. The Principal Regulations are amended by the insertion of the following 

Regulation after Regulation 8: 

“Sharing of personal data 

(1) 

Subject to this Regulation, the Minister may, solely for 
8A. 
the purpose specified in paragraph (3), share relevant personal data with 
the body known in Northern Ireland as the Public Health Agency (in this 
Regulation referred to as the ‘Agency’) in accordance with an agreement 
in writing between the Minister and the Agency specifying the terms and 
conditions applicable to such sharing. 

(2) 

An agreement referred to in paragraph (1) shall - 

(a) 

(b) 

designate the Agency as an independent data 
controller in relation to the processing of relevant 
personal data shared by the Minister in accordance 
with the agreement, and 

include such terms and conditions as are necessary 
to ensure that appropriate safeguards are in place 
to minimise the effects of the sharing of the 
relevant personal data on the rights of the data 
subjects concerned. 

(3) 

The purpose referred to in paragraph (1) is to assist the 
Agency in limiting the spread of Covid-19 in Northern Ireland by 
enabling the Agency to - 

(a) 

(b) 

provide public health information to relevant 
international passengers, and 

identify, trace and contact relevant international 
passengers who have been in contact with persons 
who have been diagnosed, or are suspected of 
having been infected, with Covid-19. 

(4) 

In this Regulation - 

‘relevant personal data’ means personal data provided on a Covid-19 
Passenger Locator Form by a relevant international passenger; 

‘relevant international passenger’ means an international passenger 
whose place of residence as specified on the Covid-19 Passenger Locator 
form is in Northern Ireland.”.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) and
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations, made under section 31A of the Health Act 1947 (inserted by 
section 10 of the Health (Preservation and Protection and other Emergency 
Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020, amend S.I. No. 45 of 2021 - Health 
Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Requirements) (Covid- 19 Passenger 
Locator Form) Regulations 2020. 

These Regulations provide for a requirement that international passengers 
travelling to the State (including via Northern Ireland) from overseas complete 
the COVID-19 Passenger Locator Form (PLF) electronically and prior to their 
arrival in the State. The Regulations also provide for the sharing of passenger 
data with the Northern Ireland Public Health Agency.
